titleStmt.title: The discription of the contrey of Aphrique the fyrst part of the worlde, with the cituation of al the countreys together, with the perticuler maners lawes, and ceremonies, of dyuers people inhabityng in the same part. Translated out of Frenche into Englyshe by Wyllyam Prat of London, the fyrst daye of the newe yere, M.CCCCC.LIIII. Rede it dylygently, marke it perfectly, reuolue it thorowly, beare it equally, beholde the auctours simplicitie, and prayse God almyghty.
Omnium gentium mores. Book 1. English
titleStmt.author: Joannes, ca. 1485-1535.
Prat, William.

publicationStmt.publisher: In Fletestrete at the signe of the George next to saynt Dunstones Churche by Wyllyam Powel],

notesStmt.note: A translation of book 1 of Boemus, Johannes. Omnium gentium mores.
Imprint from colophon; publication date from STC.
Identified as STC 191 on UMI microfilm.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the signe of the George next to saynt Dunstones Churche
